head.citation-title: 7th International Workshop on Machine Learning in Medical Imaging, MLMI 2016 held in conjunction with 19th International Conference on Medical Image Computing and Computer-Assisted Intervention, MICCAI 2016
head.abstracts: The proceedings contain 38 papers. The special focus in this conference is on Machine Learning in Medical Imaging. The topics include: Identifying high order brain connectome biomarkers via learning on hypergraph; bilateral regularization in reproducing kernel Hilbert spaces for discontinuity preserving image registration; building an ensemble of complementary segmentation methods by exploiting probabilistic estimates; learning appearance and shape evolution for infant image registration in the first year of life; detecting osteophytes in radiographs of the knee to diagnose osteoarthritis; direct estimation of fiber orientations using deep learning in diffusion imaging; dual-layer groupwise registration for consistent labeling of longitudinal brain images; joint discriminative and representative feature selection for Alzheimer’s disease diagnosis; patch-based hippocampus segmentation using a local subspace learning method; a semi-supervised large margin algorithm for white matter hyperintensity segmentation; deep ensemble sparse regression network for Alzheimer’s disease diagnosis; learning representation for histopathological image with quaternion grassmann average network; learning global and cluster-specific classifiers for robust brain extraction in MR data; segmentation-free estimation of kidney volumes in CT with dual regression forests; retinal image quality classification using saliency maps and CNNs; unsupervised discovery of emphysema subtypes in a large clinical cohort; tree-based transforms for privileged learning; automated 3d ultrasound biometry planes extraction for first trimester fetal assessment and learning-based 3T brain MRI segmentation with guidance from 7T MRI labeling.

coredata.dc:description: The proceedings contain 38 papers. The special focus in this conference is on Machine Learning in Medical Imaging. The topics include: Identifying high order brain connectome biomarkers via learning on hypergraph; bilateral regularization in reproducing kernel Hilbert spaces for discontinuity preserving image registration; building an ensemble of complementary segmentation methods by exploiting probabilistic estimates; learning appearance and shape evolution for infant image registration in the first year of life; detecting osteophytes in radiographs of the knee to diagnose osteoarthritis; direct estimation of fiber orientations using deep learning in diffusion imaging; dual-layer groupwise registration for consistent labeling of longitudinal brain images; joint discriminative and representative feature selection for Alzheimer’s disease diagnosis; patch-based hippocampus segmentation using a local subspace learning method; a semi-supervised large margin algorithm for white matter hyperintensity segmentation; deep ensemble sparse regression network for Alzheimer’s disease diagnosis; learning representation for histopathological image with quaternion grassmann average network; learning global and cluster-specific classifiers for robust brain extraction in MR data; segmentation-free estimation of kidney volumes in CT with dual regression forests; retinal image quality classification using saliency maps and CNNs; unsupervised discovery of emphysema subtypes in a large clinical cohort; tree-based transforms for privileged learning; automated 3d ultrasound biometry planes extraction for first trimester fetal assessment and learning-based 3T brain MRI segmentation with guidance from 7T MRI labeling.
